context: parotidectomy procedure   (medical transcription sample report)
a preauricular incision was made with the incision extending behind the earlobe and down slightly into the neck.
anterior and posterior skin flaps were developed.

text: heavy fascia overlying the parotid gland
context: the heavy fascia overlying the parotid gland was left intact.
posteriorly, the mastoid process and the anterior edge of the sternocleidomastoid were identified.

text: cartilage of the external auditory canal

using a mixter clamp the temporoparotid fascia was carefully elevated and transsected.

then the frontotemporal branch and the marginal mandibular cervical branch were dissected using a clamp and a #12-blade and transsected through the gland.

then the buccal and orbital branches were dissected out in like fashion until the nerve was seen to fall away from the gland.

a suction drain was inserted into the depth of the wound and brought out through the skin posteriorly.
subcutaneous sutures of 4-0 vicryl were used for closure of the muscles and fat layer.
the skin was closed with interrupted running 6-0 nylon sutures.
